meanings.definition: The yellow part of an egg.
meanings.sent1: I like to eat the yelks of eggs for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to break the yelks when cracking an egg.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dropped the yelks, making a mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The yelks of the eggs shone like drops of sunshine on the plate.
meanings.sent5: The yelks add a rich flavor and color to the scrambled eggs.

meanings.definition: To remove the yelks from an egg.
meanings.sent1: She carefully yelks the eggs before baking a cake.
meanings.sent2: Remember to yelk the eggs before adding them to the batter.
meanings.sent3: He yelks the eggs with precision, never wasting any of the yelk.
meanings.sent4: The baker yelks the eggs swiftly, expertly separating the yelks from the whites.
meanings.sent5: Yelking the eggs is an important step in many recipes.

meanings.sent1: The bright yelks of the sunflower stood out in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The yelks of the sunflower attract bees and butterflies.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to steal the yelks from the sunflower, but the birds chased it away.
meanings.sent4: The yelks of the sunflower seemed to follow the sun's path across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The golden yelks of the sunflower brought warmth to the garden.
